Description: Aging has profound effects at systemic, organ, tissue, cellular, and molecular levels and greatly increases the risk of a cancer diagnosis. Age-stratified outcomes have been observed across many adult cancers and in many cases, older patients suffer worse outcomes than younger patients. Emerging evidence indicates that age-related processes ultimately impact cancer initiation, progression, treatment tolerability, and therapeutic responses. The speakers in this major symposium will discuss current understanding of age-related processes and their impact on cancer. This session will also challenge the community to ask whether we need age-stratified treatment approaches to tackle cancer.
SearchResultBody: SY24. Role of Aging in Cancer
Title: Role of Aging in Cancer
